title: Gold Rush Lingo
description: Strike it rich with vocabulary from the California Gold Rush era (1848-1855)

questions.question: During the Gold Rush, what was a 'forty-niner'?
options: A prospector who came to California in 1849

questions.question: What did 'pay dirt' mean in Gold Rush slang?
options: Soil or gravel containing enough gold to be profitable

questions.question: In Gold Rush vocabulary, what was a 'placer' mine?
options: A mine where gold was extracted from surface deposits by washing
A fake mine used to scam investors

questions.question: What was a 'stake' in Gold Rush terminology?
options: A claim to a piece of land for mining

questions.question: During the Gold Rush, what did 'panning' refer to?
options: Using a shallow pan to wash gold from gravel in a stream

questions.question: What was a 'grubstake' in Gold Rush parlance?
options: Supplies or money given to a miner in exchange for a share of findings

questions.question: In Gold Rush slang, what did 'color' mean?
options: Traces of gold found in a pan or sample

questions.question: What was a 'sluice box' during the Gold Rush?
options: A long narrow trough used to separate gold from gravel using water

questions.question: During the Gold Rush, what was a 'bonanza'?
options: A large and rich mineral deposit or source of wealth

questions.question: What did 'staking a claim' mean during the Gold Rush?
options: Officially marking and registering a plot of land for mining
Driving stakes into the ground for a tent

questions.question: In Gold Rush terminology, what was a 'mother lode'?
options: The principal vein or zone of gold-bearing rock

questions.question: What was a 'nugget' in Gold Rush vocabulary?
options: A lump of native gold found in the earth

questions.question: During the Gold Rush, what was a 'claim jumper'?
options: Someone who illegally seized another miner's claim

questions.question: What did 'strike it rich' originally mean in Gold Rush language?
options: To discover a valuable deposit of gold

questions.question: In Gold Rush slang, what was a 'tenderfoot'?
options: A newcomer unfamiliar with the rough conditions of mining life
